resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

   Please advise.

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.summary: [C++][Substrait] "ignore_unknown_fields" should be specified when converting JSON to binary

comments.body: Does this need to be marked blocker? I don't think we support Substrait officially, and the spec is still in an early stage.
Is this one an actual blocker? We are not really exposing Substrait usage to the public, so I guess it can land at any time during 10.0.0 too

Hmm...I suppose.  I had thought we would get further along with Substrait then we had.  We should maybe hide the Substrait docs [here|https://arrow.apache.org/docs/dev/cpp/streaming_execution.html#substrait] for the 9.0.0 release then.  They're accurate but somewhat underwhelming and it might be better to advertise nothing.
That being said, the PR available for this JIRA is probably ready to merge.
